Bash(git commit -m "$(cat <<''EOF''
fix(security): remove TOCTOU race condition in atomic file writes

Remove unnecessary fs.existsSync + fs.unlinkSync before fs.renameSync
in storage modules. This pattern creates a Time-of-Check Time-of-Use
(CWE-367) race condition window where:

1. An attacker could exploit the gap between unlink and rename
2. A symlink attack could redirect file operations outside intended paths
3. Concurrent processes could cause unexpected behavior

The fix relies on fs.renameSync''s atomic overwrite behavior on POSIX
systems, which atomically replaces the destination file without needing
to unlink first.

Validated against:
- CVE-2025-46328 (Snowflake Node.js TOCTOU)
- CVE-2025-64118 (node-tar race condition)
- CWE-367 (TOCTOU Race Condition)
- Node.js fs.exists deprecation guidance

Reference: https://github.com/jprichardson/node-fs-extra/issues/835
